titles.title: Permanent Active Financing Exception Act of 2014
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend the subpart F exemption for active financing income.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 21 - 14.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 113-427.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 315.

bill.summary: 5/2/2014--Reported to House amended. Permanent Active Financing Exception Act of 2014 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to make permanent the subpart F foreign personal holding company income exemption for income that is derived in the active conduct of a banking, financing, or similar business, as a securities dealer, or in the conduct of an insurance business.
